oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Confederate soldier David Z. Morrison during fighting around Marietta, GA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written in line of battle near Marietta, GA, Morrison of the 38th Tenn. Inf. CSA writes of fighting during the Atlanta campaign. Says they have "been under the fire of the enemy 45 out of [last] 51 days.""We have built a great many breastworks and fortifications on this seige. Morrison is interrupted by a Union attack which is repulsed with "light" losses "as we were in good fortifications." Mentions death of his brother James Morrison. Letter is transcribed.
